ai-mn91:38.4_0: For seven days, Brahmāyu served and satisfied the mendicant Saṅgha headed by the Buddha with his own hands with a variety of delicious foods.
ai-mn91:39.1_0: When seven days had passed the Buddha left,
ai-mn91:39.2_0: Not long after the Buddha left, Brahmāyu passed away.
ai-mn91:39.3_0: Then many monks went to the Fortunate One,
ai-mn91:39.3_1: After bowing down to the Buddha, they sat down,
ai-mn91:39.5_0: Where have they been reborn in the next life?”
ai-mn91:39.6_0: “Mendicants, Brahmāyu was astute. He practiced in line with the teachings, and did not trouble me about the teachings.
ai-mn91:39.7_0: With the ending of the five lower fetters, he’s been reborn spontaneously and will become extinguished there, not liable to return from that world.”
ai-mn91:39.8_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-mn91:39.9_0: Satisfied, the mendicants were happy with what the Buddha said.
ai-mn91:39.10_0: The first chapter on Brahmā is finished.
